thread.title: NYCFC’s latest loss also hurt the Red Bulls
thread.title_full: NYCFC’s latest loss also hurt the Red Bulls | New York Post

author: Associated Press
title: NYCFC’s latest loss also hurt the Red Bulls
text:
WASHINGTON — Alvaro Saborio knocked in a loose ball on a free kick in the 92nd minute and D.C. United beat New York City FC 2-1 on a rainy Friday night to secure an Eastern Conference playoff spot.
D.C. United (14-12-6) snapped its six-game winless stretch to move into a first-place tie with the Red Bulls. NYCFC (10-15-7) had its three-game winning streak stopped.
Frank Lampard opened the scoring in the first minute for the fastest goal for NYCFC this season. Bill Hamid blocked David Villa’s fast-break attempt and Lampard slotted the rebound for his third goal in his last four games.
Fabian Espindola tied it in the 73rd minute. Josh Saunders dove to get a hand on Chris Pontius’ shot and Espindola put in the rebound.
Villa sent a ball just over the crossbar in the 41st and rolled one wide of the near post in first-half stoppage time.
